title: PM Modi calls chess champion Gukesh an embodiment of calmness, humility - Business Standard
summary:
PM Modi Meets Chess World Champion Gukesh, Praises His Determination and Humility

Date: December 28, 2024
Source: Times of India

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with newly-crowned chess world champion D Gukesh and praised the 18-year-old for his determination, dedication, and humility.

  1. Gukesh became the youngest chess world champion, surpassing Garry Kasparov's record.
  2. PM Modi met with Gukesh and his parents, commending their efforts in his journey to the world title.
  3. Gukesh gifted PM Modi the chessboard used in his winning game.

Had an excellent interaction with chess champion and India’s pride, @DGukesh!  I have been closely interacting with him for a few years now, and what strikes me most about him is his determination and dedication. His confidence is truly inspiring.

In fact, I recall seeing a video of his few years ago where he had said he would become the youngest world champion - a prediction that has now clearly come true thanks to his own efforts.

Along with confidence, Gukesh embodies calmness and humility. Upon winning, he was composed, basking in his glory while fully understanding how to process this hard-earned victory. Our conversation today revolved around the transformative potential of yoga and meditation.

In the success of every athlete, their parents play a pivotal role. I complimented Gukesh's parents for supporting him through thick and thin. Their dedication will inspire countless parents of young aspirants who dream of pursuing sports as a career.

I am also delighted to have received from Gukesh the original chessboard from the game he won. The chessboard, autographed by both him and Ding Liren, is a cherished memento.

After the meeting, Gukesh expressed his gratitude and humility towards the PM's support and encouragement.
newTitle: PM Modi Meets Chess World Champion Gukesh, Praises His Determination and Humility

title: 'We followed the rules, Magnus Carlsen didn't': FIDE deputy prez Viswanathan Anand - The Times of India
summary:
Chess World Reacts to Magnus Carlsen's Breach of Rules: Anand Speaks Out

Published on October 12, 2023, in Times of India

In a surprising turn of events, five-time world chess champion Magnus Carlsen has been accused of breaking tournament rules, sparking a wave of reactions from the chess community. The World Chess Federation (FIDE) deputy president, Viswanathan Anand, has spoken out against Carlsen's actions.

  1. Carlsen was seen playing a rapid game on a different platform while participating in the Sinquefield Cup.
  2. This breach of rules has led to widespread discussion and criticism in the chess community.
  3. Anand, a former world champion himself, has criticized Carlsen's actions, stating that they disrespect the tournament and fellow players.

“We followed the rules, Magnus Carlsen didn’t. It’s as simple as that.” - Viswanathan Anand

Carlsen's actions have ignited a debate about sportsmanship and the integrity of chess tournaments. While some support Carlsen's right to express himself, others argue that his actions set a poor example for younger players.
newTitle: Chess World Reacts to Magnus Carlsen's Breach of Rules: Anand Speaks Out

title: Nitish Kumar Reddy Rewarded With Massive Cash Prize From Andhra Cricket Association - NDTV Sports
summary:
Nitish Kumar Reddy Rewarded With Massive Cash Prize From Andhra Cricket Association

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Andhra Cricket Association has awarded a cash prize of Rs 25 lakh to Nitish Kumar Reddy in recognition of his impressive Test performance, which played a significant role in India's comeback during the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.

  • The ACA announced a cash prize of Rs 25 lakh for Reddy.
  • Reddy scored an unbeaten 105 runs, helping India reach 358 for nine.
  • His performance was instrumental in India's fightback in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • Reddy has been highlighted as a standout player in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Cricket legends praised his innings, with Sunil Gavaskar calling it one of the greatest Test knocks.
"It is a fortunate day and a happiest moment for the Andhra Cricket Association," said ACA President Kesineni Sivanath.

Nitish Kumar Reddy's achievement not only highlights his talent but also brings pride to the region, marking a significant milestone in his cricketing career.
newTitle: Nitish Kumar Reddy Rewarded With Massive Cash Prize From Andhra Cricket Association

title: 'That's why you're not head coach': Australian legends in heated debate over Rishabh Pant's dismissal - The Times of India
summary:
Debate Erupts Over Rishabh Pant's Dismissal in Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: Date Not Specified | Source: Times of India

The dismissal of Rishabh Pant during the Boxing Day Test at the MCG has sparked intense discussions among Australian cricket legends regarding his shot selection.

  • Rishabh Pant attempted a scoop shot but was caught, leading to disagreements among commentators.
  • Mark Waugh criticized Pant's shot selection, citing game situation and risks involved.
  • Michael Hussey defended Pant's playing style, advocating for players' freedom to play audacious shots.
  • Michael Vaughan supported Hussey's stance, praising Pant's talent.
  • The debate highlighted differing coaching philosophies on aggressive play and shot selection.
Mark Waugh: "That's unacceptable... there were two men back for that exact shot."
Michael Hussey: "That's the way he likes to play... it is a poor shot, don't get me wrong."

This discussion reflects the tension between maintaining aggressive batting styles and adhering to strategic play in cricket.
newTitle: Debate Erupts Over Rishabh Pant's Dismissal in Boxing Day Test

title: "You can't be successful in Test cricket": Sunil Gavaskar warns Rishabh Pant of serious consequences - Crictoday
summary:
Gavaskar's Warning to Rishabh Pant on Test Cricket Success

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Sunil Gavaskar cautions Rishabh Pant about his batting approach in Test cricket, emphasizing the need for a more grounded and cautious style to ensure success.

  • Mark Nicholas questioned how long India can allow Pant to play recklessly.
  • Pant's aggressive style has often led to his downfall, as highlighted in a recent match.
  • Gavaskar suggests Pant should bat lower in the order if he continues to adopt this approach.
  • The conversation included a consensus on the need for Pant to change his batting strategy for better performance.
“You can’t be successful in Test cricket by going aerial... His conversation rate is not good in Test cricket.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's remarks reflect a broader concern about Pant’s ability to adapt his game at the Test level, suggesting that a more measured approach could yield better results.
newTitle: Gavaskar's Warning to Rishabh Pant on Test Cricket Success

title: 'Nitish Reddy’s first-class average is 22': Sanjay Manjrekar marvels at youngster's knock - The Times of India
summary:
Sanjay Manjrekar Praises Nitish Reddy's Maiden Test Century

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Times of India

Nitish Kumar Reddy's remarkable performance in the fourth Test against Australia has drawn acclaim from former cricket stars, showcasing his ability to excel despite a modest first-class average.

  • Nitish Reddy scored an unbeaten 105 runs from 176 balls, contributing significantly to India's total of 358/9 by the end of Day 3.
  • His partnership with Washington Sundar was pivotal, worth 127 runs for the eighth wicket.
  • Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar expressed amazement at Reddy's maturity, noting his first-class average of only 22.
  • Other cricketers, including Irfan Pathan, highlighted the historic nature of the partnership between Reddy and Sundar, which endured over 300 deliveries.
  • Reddy's performance provides hope for India's prospects in Test cricket.
“There has never been an instance where the number 8 and 9 batsman in the Indian team have played over 300 deliveries.” - Irfan Pathan

Reddy's innings is seen as a significant step for Indian cricket, combining technique and determination to inspire future generations of players.
newTitle: Sanjay Manjrekar Praises Nitish Reddy's Maiden Test Century

Nitish Reddy scored his maiden Test century, earning praise from legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar as he rescued India from a tough position against Australia.

  • Reddy scored an unbeaten 105, leading a vital partnership with Washington Sundar.
  • India finished Day 3 at 385/9, trailing Australia's 474 runs.
  • Gavaskar referred to Reddy as a future star of Indian cricket.
  • Ravi Shastri suggested Reddy should be promoted in the batting order due to his consistent performances.
  • Reddy hit 10 fours and one six during his historic innings.
“This is the first Test hundred and he is going to score many more in the near future.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The conclusion of Reddy's performance solidifies his role as a key player for India's future in cricket, with expectations for further achievements.

The ICC has unveiled the shortlist for the Women’s Emerging Cricketer of the Year award, showcasing outstanding performances from young talents from South Africa, Scotland, India, and Ireland.

  • Annerie Dercksen (SA): Impressive all-round performances including 161 runs and 11 wickets across formats.

  • Freya Sargent (IRE): Emerging star with impressive debut performances, including a standout T20I match against England.

“These young athletes have displayed exceptional talent and composure on the cricket field, representing the future of women's cricket.”

This year's nominees highlight the exciting potential and emerging talent in women's cricket, promising a bright future for the sport globally.

Former BCCI chief selector MSK Prasad has sharply criticized Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma for his recent performances and captaincy, particularly following a series of disappointing results against New Zealand and low scores against Australia.

  • MSK Prasad comments on Rohit Sharma's low score of just three runs in the ongoing Test against Australia.
  • He labels India's recent loss to New Zealand as "pathetic," highlighting it as a historical low for Indian cricket.
  • Prasad notes Rohit's lack of proactivity as captain and suggests his recent failures have negatively impacted the team's performance.
  • During the ongoing Test, Australia's Steve Smith scored a century, contributing to a total of 474 runs.

“We had a three-match series against New Zealand, it was pathetic. It had never happened in the history of Indian cricket that we lost three games in a row.” - MSK Prasad

title: Carlsen Quits Rapid & Blitz Championships; Murzin, Duda, Arjun, Grischuk Lead Open - Chess.com
summary:
Carlsen Withdraws from Rapid and Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Dispute

Date: December 27, 2024   Source: Chess.com

In a surprising turn of events, GM Magnus Carlsen announced he will no longer compete in the 2024 FIDE World Rapid Chess Championship due to a disagreement with the dress code enforced by FIDE. This decision ensures new champions will be crowned this year.

  • Carlsen's Withdrawal: The reigning champion received a $200 fine for wearing jeans and faced an ultimatum to change his attire.
  • Open Championship Leaders: GMs Volodar Murzin, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, Arjun Erigaisi, and Alexander Grischuk currently lead the Open championship with a score of 7/9.
  • Women’s Championship: In the 2024 FIDE Women's World Rapid Chess Championship, GMs Ju Wenjun, Harika Dronavalli, and Koneru Humpy share the lead with 6.5/8.
  • Consequences of the Dress Code: Carlsen’s exit raises questions regarding FIDE’s strict enforcement of dress codes and its implications for player participation.
"I said I'll change tomorrow... but they said you have to change now & it became a matter of principle for me so here we are!" — Magnus Carlsen

This incident not only affects the current tournaments but also highlights the ongoing tensions between players and regulatory bodies in professional chess.
newTitle: Carlsen Withdraws from Rapid and Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Dispute

title: FIDE chief urges fans to ask D Gukesh for the truth, attacks Magnus Carlsen in ‘we threatened players is a lie’ claim - Hindustan Times
summary:
FIDE chief urges fans to ask D Gukesh for the truth, attacks Magnus Carlsen in ‘we threatened players is a lie’ claim

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The FIDE chief Emil Sutovsky has publicly refuted Magnus Carlsen's accusations that players involved in the Freestyle Chess Tour were threatened. The situation intensified after notable chess figures engaged in a public dispute over the events surrounding the tournament.

  • Vladimir Kramnik accused Magnus Carlsen of manipulating FIDE regarding the Freestyle Chess Players Club.
  • Sutovsky stated that the claims of players being threatened are false.
  • Carlsen faced removal from the ongoing championship due to attire violations.
  • The Freestyle Chess Grand Slam Tour 2025 is set to begin on January 4 with major participants including Carlsen and D Gukesh.
“The claim that FIDE threatened players who were willing to participate in Freestyle Chess Tour is a lie.” - Emil Sutovsky

This ongoing conflict reveals significant tensions within the chess community as players and governing bodies navigate competition regulations and claims of integrity.

title: How Can India Qualify For World Test Championship Final If Boxing Day Test vs Australia Ends In A Dr.. - NDTV Sports
‘Magnus Carlsen was given enough time to change his jeans. We didn't ban him; could've played': FIDE CEO - Hindustan Times
summary:
FIDE CEO Explains Magnus Carlsen's Disqualification Over Dress Code

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

FIDE CEO Emil Sutovski stated that Magnus Carlsen was given ample opportunity to change into formal attire before being disqualified from the World Rapid and Blitz Championship for wearing jeans, which violated tournament regulations.

  • Sutovski clarified that Carlsen was not banned but failed to comply with the dress code.
  • He noted that rules must apply to all participants and highlighted previous penalties for similar violations.
  • Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE's dress code policies and decided to withdraw from the Blitz section of the tournament.
“I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this. I don't want anything to do with them.” - Magnus Carlsen

The situation underscores the ongoing tension between tournament regulations and player preferences regarding dress codes in chess.

title: First Time In 147 Years: Nitish Kumar Reddy, Washington Sundar Hurt Australia Bad; Achieve Historic .. - NDTV Sports
summary:
First Time In 147 Years: Nitish Kumar Reddy, Washington Sundar Hurt Australia Bad; Achieve Historic Record

Publication Date: December 28, 2024   Source: NDTV

Nitish Kumar Reddy achieved a remarkable maiden Test century at No. 8, supported by Washington Sundar, during the Boxing Day Test against Australia, marking a historic moment in cricket.

  • Nitish Kumar Reddy scored 105 runs off 176 balls, becoming the third youngest Indian to score a Test century in Australia.
  • Washington Sundar contributed with 50 runs, and together they built a crucial partnership of 127 runs.
  • This match marks the first instance in 147 years where both No. 8 and No. 9 batters faced over 150 balls each in a Test innings.
  • The emotional scene at the MCG included Reddy's father expressing joy and gratitude.
  • India ended Day 3 at 358/9, trailing Australia by 116 runs.
“This is a historic moment for Indian cricket, breaking a long-standing record and showcasing the depth of our batting.” - ESPN Cricinfo

The outstanding performance by Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar not only lifted India in a challenging match but also set a precedent for future cricket tournaments.
newTitle: Historic Performance by Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar in Boxing Day Test Against Australia

title: World rapid and blitz chess: After Carlsen disqualification, India's Arjun Erigaisi in joint lead - Deccan Herald
summary:
Arjun Erigaisi Joins Leaders After Carlsen's Disqualification at World Chess Championship

Date: 28 December 2024, Source: New York

Indian grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi has emerged as one of the co-leaders in the ongoing World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championship following a day marked by the disqualification of five-time world champion Magnus Carlsen.

  • Arjun shares the lead with Volodar Murzin, Alexander Grischuk, and Duda Jan-Kryzstof, all on seven points after round 9.
  • Carlsen was fined $200 for wearing jeans, a violation of tournament dress code, and was disqualified after refusing to comply.
  • Arjun’s chances for victory improved significantly with Carlsen's withdrawal, as Carlsen was a major contender in faster formats.
  • In the women’s section, Koneru Humpy also leads with 6.5 points after winning four consecutive games.
  • Arjun defeated Robson Ray and Shant Sargsyan and drew with Murzin and Duda in his games.
“With Carlsen's withdrawal, Arjun's chances have increased dramatically as the Norwegian is known to win anything and everything that comes under the faster version.”

The championship continues with more rounds, and anticipation builds for the upcoming matches that will further shape the standings.
newTitle: Arjun Erigaisi Joins Leaders After Carlsen's Disqualification at World Chess Championship
